title: Dataset Provenance
text: use following packages illustration. require hook API, case iidda.api::ops_staging. hook eventually changed iidda.api::ops stabilize. fact access iidda-staging repository need wait stabilize. convenience define custom print function turn messages API helpful presenting material.
code: library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(grid) library(iidda.api) api_hook = iidda.api::ops_staging print_single_row = function(data) {   (data     |> t()      |> as.data.frame()      |> setNames("Value")   ) } options(iidda_api_msgs = FALSE)

what: Example: The Last Case of Smallpox
title: Dataset Provenance
text: Smallpox eliminated Canada 1946 https://www.cmaj.ca/content/161/12/1543. IIDDA case Alberta 1980? ’s got wrong, right? one many instances one want go back source documents check whether surprising data represent errors data curation process. CANMOD data columns containing provenance information. columns give identifiers resources used produce record. smallpox case following provenance. see identifiers original dataset included compiled dataset, digitization (Excel file containing manually entered data), PDF scan original source document. identifiers use unless can use find resources. show . Let’s start scan see original source actually published late smallpox case. use ?url_scans function convert identifier URL can find document. takes time find specific part document contains datum. actually little difficult usual case, document spread columns single table across two pages. simplify cutting pasting relevant parts table together, indeed find single case smallpox Albert January 1980.  case looks like error made source document published, cases need look see introduced error curation process. next place look usually digitized Excel file, can get using ?url_digitizations function. can also find prep-scripts potentially output modified updated digitization using ?url_affected_scripts function. Finally, note url_* functions nicely paired base R ?browseURL function.
code: smallpox = api_hook$filter(resource_type = "Compilation"   , dataset_ids = "canmod-cdi-normalized"   , basal_disease = "smallpox" ) latest_smallpox = (smallpox   |> filter(cases_this_period > 0)   |> filter(max(period_start_date) == period_start_date) ) (latest_smallpox   |> select(     , iso_3166_2     , period_start_date     , period_end_date     , cases_this_period   )    |> print_single_row() ) #>                        Value #> iso_3166_2             CA-AB #> period_start_date 1979-12-30 #> period_end_date   1980-01-26 #> cases_this_period          1 provenance = (latest_smallpox   |> distinct(       original_dataset_id     , digitization_id     , scan_id   ) ) print_single_row(provenance) #>                                               Value #> original_dataset_id cdi_ca_1979-83_4wk_prov_statcan #> digitization_id     cdi_ca_1979-83_4wk_prov_statcan #> scan_id             cdi_ca_1979-83_4wk_prov_statcan url_scans(provenance$scan_id) #> [1] "https://github.com/davidearn/iidda/blob/main/pipelines/cdi_ca_1979-89_4wk_prov/scans/cdi_ca_1979-83_4wk_prov_statcan.pdf" url_digitizations(provenance$digitization_id) #> [1] "https://github.com/davidearn/iidda/blob/main/pipelines/cdi_ca_1979-89_4wk_prov/digitizations/cdi_ca_1979-83_4wk_prov_statcan.xlsx" url_affected_scripts(provenance$digitization_id) #> [1] "https://github.com/davidearn/iidda/blob/main/pipelines/cdi_ca_1979-89_4wk_prov/prep-scripts/cdi_ca_1979-83_4wk_province_statisticscanada.R"  #> [2] "https://github.com/davidearn/iidda/blob/main/pipelines/canmod-cross-checks/prep-scripts/canmod-time-scale-cross-check.R"                     #> [3] "https://github.com/davidearn/iidda/blob/main/pipelines/canmod-cross-checks/prep-scripts/canmod-location-cross-check.R"                       #> [4] "https://github.com/davidearn/iidda/blob/main/pipelines/canmod-cross-checks/prep-scripts/canmod-disease-cross-check.R"                        #> [5] "https://github.com/davidearn/iidda/blob/main/pipelines/canmod-compilations/prep-scripts/canmod-cdi-unharmonized.R"                           #> [6] "https://github.com/davidearn/iidda/blob/main/pipelines/canmod-compilations/prep-scripts/canmod-cdi-harmonized.R"                             #> [7] "https://github.com/davidearn/iidda/blob/main/pipelines/cdi_ca_1979-89_4wk_prov_harmonized/prep-scripts/cdi_ca_1979-89_4wk_prov_harmonized.R" #> [8] "https://github.com/davidearn/iidda/blob/main/pipelines/canmod-compilations/prep-scripts/canmod-cdi-normalized.R"

title: Quickstart
text: use following packages illustration. also turn messages API helpful presenting material.

title: Quickstart
text: Data canmod digitization project provides communicable disease incidence data notifiable infectious diseases, including scarlet fever. name main dataset project canmod-cdi-normalized, can get filter using following ?featured_data command.
code: scarlet_fever_ontario = featured_data(     dataset_id = "canmod-cdi-normalized"   , iso_3166 = "CA"   , iso_3166_2 = "CA-ON"   , time_scale = "wk"   , basal_disease = "scarlet-fever"   , period_end_date = "1929-08-01..1930-10-01" ) print(scarlet_fever_ontario) #> # A tibble: 61 × 21 #>    iso_3166 iso_3166_2 period_start_date period_end_date disease nesting_disease #>    <chr>    <chr>      <date>            <date>          <chr>   <chr>           #>  1 CA       CA-ON      1929-07-28        1929-08-03      scarle… ""              #>  2 CA       CA-ON      1929-08-04        1929-08-10      scarle… ""              #>  3 CA       CA-ON      1929-08-11        1929-08-17      scarle… ""              #>  4 CA       CA-ON      1929-08-18        1929-08-24      scarle… ""              #>  5 CA       CA-ON      1929-08-25        1929-08-31      scarle… ""              #>  6 CA       CA-ON      1929-09-01        1929-09-07      scarle… ""              #>  7 CA       CA-ON      1929-09-08        1929-09-14      scarle… ""              #>  8 CA       CA-ON      1929-09-15        1929-09-21      scarle… ""              #>  9 CA       CA-ON      1929-09-22        1929-09-28      scarle… ""              #> 10 CA       CA-ON      1929-09-29        1929-10-05      scarle… ""              #> # ℹ 51 more rows #> # ℹ 15 more variables: basal_disease <chr>, cases_this_period <dbl>, #> #   location <chr>, location_type <chr>, time_scale <chr>, #> #   historical_disease <chr>, historical_disease_family <chr>, #> #   historical_disease_subclass <chr>, days_this_period <dbl>, #> #   period_mid_date <date>, population <dbl>, record_origin <chr>, #> #   original_dataset_id <chr>, digitization_id <chr>, scan_id <chr> (scarlet_fever_ontario   |> ggplot(aes(period_end_date, cases_this_period))   + geom_line() + geom_point()   + ggtitle("Scarlet Fever Incidence in Ontario, Canada")   + theme_bw() )

title: Authors and Citation
text: Steve Walker. Author, maintainer.

title: IIDDA API
text: iidda.api package used get data API International Infectious Disease Data Archive (IIDDA), can installed following R command.

title: IIDDA API
text: Package intro Package function reference Package vignettes

title: IIDDA API
text: https://github.com/stevencarlislewalker

title: IIDDA API
text: work supported NSERC CANMOD network.

title: Featured Datasets — featured
text: Access featured datasets associated metadata. datasets required substantial preparation enhance utility research analysis.

title: Featured Datasets — featured
text: dataset_id ID particular featured dataset. Run featured_ids() list available options. ... Character vectors filtering data specific columns, one vector column. See examples syntax different types columns. following list gives instructions columns might available dataset. available get message telling columns dataset asking . location : Location descriptor reported original source. iso_3166 : ISO-3166 codes locations corresponding countries. iso_3166_2 : ISO-3166-2 codes locations corresponding sub-national jurisdictions. date : Date time point value reported, ISO-8601 format (.e. YYYY-MM-DD). Must form \<start date\>..<end date\>. period_start_date : first date within time interval count reported, ISO-8601 format (.e. YYYY-MM-DD). Must form \<start date\>..<end date\>. period_end_date : last date within time interval count reported, ISO-8601 format (.e. YYYY-MM-DD). Must form \<start date\>..<end date\>. period_mid_date : Date (rounded ) middle time interval count reported, ISO-8601 format (.e. YYYY-MM-DD). Must form \<start date\>..<end date\>. historical_disease_family : Disease family reported original source. historical_disease : Disease name reported original source. disease : Disease name harmonized data sources. nesting_disease : Disease name encapsulates disease hierarchy diseases. basal_disease : Base disease name encapsulates disease hierarchy diseases. icd_9 : Disease codes version 9 International Statistical Classification Diseases Related Health Problems, published World Health Organization. icd_7 : Disease codes version 7 International Statistical Classification Diseases Related Health Problems, published World Health Organization. historical_disease_subclass : Disease subclass reported original source – cf. Disease icd_9_subclass : Disease codes associated subclass identified original source. Codes version 9 International Statistical Classification Diseases Related Health Problems, published World Health Organization. icd_7_subclass : Disease codes associated subclass identified original source. Codes version 7 International Statistical Classification Diseases Related Health Problems, published World Health Organization. lower_age : Lower age bound years individuals associated particular record. first item must either number interval form \<min\>-\<max\> 'none' (meaning filter applied case numbers). Additional items meant 'unavailable values' like 'available', 'reportable', 'null'. upper_age : Upper age bound years individuals associated particular record. first item must either number interval form \<min\>-\<max\> 'none' (meaning filter applied case numbers). Additional items meant 'unavailable values' like 'available', 'reportable', 'null'. sex : Sex individuals associated particular record reported original source. cases_this_period : Number cases reported period, end period – reported original source. Includes different types missing values reported original source. Type "string" allows different types missing values specified reported original source allows users choose type missing values work . first item must either number interval form \<min\>-\<max\> 'none' (meaning filter applied case numbers). Additional items meant 'unavailable values' like 'available', 'reportable', 'null'. cases_prev_period : Number cases reported previous period, end current period – reported original source. Includes different types missing values reported original source. Type "string" allows different types missing values specified reported original source allows users choose type missing values work . first item must either number interval form \<min\>-\<max\> 'none' (meaning filter applied case numbers). Additional items meant 'unavailable values' like 'available', 'reportable', 'null'. cases_cum_report_year : Total number cases current period, current year – reported original source. Includes different types missing values reported original source. Type "string" allows different types missing values specified reported original source allows users choose type missing values work . first item must either number interval form \<min\>-\<max\> 'none' (meaning filter applied case numbers). Additional items meant 'unavailable values' like 'available', 'reportable', 'null'. cases_cum_prev_year : Total number cases current period, previous year – reported original source. Includes different types missing values reported original source. Type "string" allows different types missing values specified reported original source allows users choose type missing values work . cases_median_prev_5_years : Median number weekly cases current period, median taken previous five years – reported original source. Includes different types missing values reported original source. Type "string" allows different types missing values specified reported original source allows users choose type missing values work . first item must either number interval form \<min\>-\<max\> 'none' (meaning filter applied case numbers). Additional items meant 'unavailable values' like 'available', 'reportable', 'null'. cases_cum_median_prev_5_years : Median number cumulative cases current period, median taken previous five years – reported original source. Includes different types missing values reported original source. Type "string" allows different types missing values specified reported original source allows users choose type missing values work . first item must either number interval form \<min\>-\<max\> 'none' (meaning filter applied case numbers). Additional items meant 'unavailable values' like 'available', 'reportable', 'null'. population : Estimated total number individuals associated particular record. first item must either number interval form \<min\>-\<max\> 'none' (meaning filter applied case numbers). Additional items meant 'unavailable values' like 'available', 'reportable', 'null'. cause : Cause mortality reported original source. location_type : Location type recorded data (continents, countries, canadian-provinces, canadian-cities, ontario-cities, uk-cities, london-parishes) given record. time_scale : Time scale recorded data (wk, 2wk, mo, qr, yr) given record. field qualitative approximate measure time scale data counted. example, monthly (mo) data might include four-weekly even five-weekly data. See columns like days_this_period quantitative description time scale available, produce description using period_start_date period_end_date.

title: Featured Datasets — featured
text: featured_data(): Return data frame featured dataset, possibly filtered. featured_metadata(): Return list lists, represents metadata featured dataset. featured_ids(): Return IDs featured datasets repository.

title: Featured Datasets — featured
code: options(iidda_api_msgs = FALSE) featured_ids() #> [1] "canmod-cdi-harmonized"   "canmod-cdi-normalized"   #> [3] "canmod-cdi-unharmonized" "canmod-mort-harmonized"  #> [5] "canmod-mort-normalized"  "canmod-pop-normalized"   atlantic_polio_1950s = featured_data("canmod-cdi-normalized"   , iso_3166_2 = c("CA-NL", "CA-NS", "CA-PE", "CA-NB")   , basal_disease = "poliomyelitis"   , period_end_date = "1950-01-01..1959-12-31" ) head(atlantic_polio_1950s) #> # A tibble: 6 × 21 #>   iso_3166 iso_3166_2 period_start_date period_end_date disease  nesting_disease #>   <chr>    <chr>      <date>            <date>          <chr>    <chr>           #> 1 CA       CA-NL      1950-01-01        1950-01-07      poliomy… poliomyelitis   #> 2 CA       CA-NL      1950-01-01        1950-01-07      poliomy… poliomyelitis   #> 3 CA       CA-NL      1950-01-01        1950-01-07      poliomy… poliomyelitis   #> 4 CA       CA-NL      1950-01-08        1950-01-14      poliomy… poliomyelitis   #> 5 CA       CA-NL      1950-01-08        1950-01-14      poliomy… poliomyelitis   #> 6 CA       CA-NL      1950-01-08        1950-01-14      poliomy… poliomyelitis   #> # ℹ 15 more variables: basal_disease <chr>, cases_this_period <dbl>, #> #   location <chr>, location_type <chr>, time_scale <chr>, #> #   historical_disease <chr>, historical_disease_family <chr>, #> #   historical_disease_subclass <chr>, days_this_period <dbl>, #> #   period_mid_date <date>, population <dbl>, record_origin <chr>, #> #   original_dataset_id <chr>, digitization_id <chr>, scan_id <chr>

title: iidda.api — iidda.api-package
text: R wrapper IIDDA API.

title: iidda.api — iidda.api-package
text: IIDDA International Infectious Disease Data Archive. archive API (Application Programming Interface) accessing data potentially building applications. R package provides simple wrapper API datasets returned data frames. Useful links people just want get data. ?featured vignette("Quickstart") vignette("Provenance") advanced users might interested lower-level wrapper API operations : ?ops.

title: IIDDA API Operations — ops
text: ops: List containing available operations IIDDA API R functions ops_local: Operations list local development environment, exists ops_staging: Operations list staging environment, exists

title: IIDDA API Operations — ops
code: ## Print out the available functions. names(ops_staging) #> [1] "metadata"        "data_dictionary" "lookup_tables"   "raw_csv"         #> [5] "download"        "filter"           ## Access functions with a dollar sign. For example, this command ## will give weekly incidence data in January of 1956. options(iidda_api_msgs = FALSE, iidda_api_all_char = TRUE) jan_56 = ops_staging$filter(      resource_type = "Communicable Disease Incidence"    , dataset_id = "cdi_ca_1956_wk_prov_dbs"    , period_end_date = "1956-01-01..1956-02-01"    , time_scale = "wk" ) cols = c(     "period_end_date"   , "location"   , "historical_disease"   , "cases_this_period" ) print(jan_56[, cols]) #> # A tibble: 1,232 × 4 #>    period_end_date location historical_disease cases_this_period #>    <chr>           <chr>    <chr>              <chr>             #>  1 1956-01-07      CANADA   Chickenpox         927               #>  2 1956-01-07      NFLD.    Chickenpox         9                 #>  3 1956-01-07      P.E.I.   Chickenpox         4                 #>  4 1956-01-07      N.S      Chickenpox         25                #>  5 1956-01-07      N.B.     Chickenpox         0                 #>  6 1956-01-07      QUE.     Chickenpox         182               #>  7 1956-01-07      ONT.     Chickenpox         511               #>  8 1956-01-07      MAN.     Chickenpox         3                 #>  9 1956-01-07      SASK.    Chickenpox         Not reportable    #> 10 1956-01-07      ALTA.    Chickenpox         Not reportable    #> # ℹ 1,222 more rows  ## Operations objects that are not available are error objects. As of the ## time of writing `ops` is not live, but will be. print(class(ops)) #> [1] "try-error"  ## The `ops_local` is only live for developers who have deployed a ## local version of the API. print(class(ops_local)) #> [1] "try-error"

title: Data Provenance — urls
text: Get URLs dependencies datasets investigating data provenance. See vignette("Provenance") illustration. See iidda-staging information IIDDA identifiers. access link, please contact maintainer.

title: Data Provenance — urls
code: url_scans(   scan_ids,   dataset_ids = character(),   metadata = ops_staging$metadata(dataset_ids = dataset_ids) )  url_digitizations(   digitization_ids,   dataset_ids = character(),   metadata = ops_staging$metadata(dataset_ids = dataset_ids) )  url_affected_scripts(   digitization_id,   dataset_ids = character(),   metadata = ops_staging$metadata(dataset_ids = dataset_ids) )

title: Data Provenance — urls
text: scan_ids Character vector identifiers scans. dataset_ids Identifiers datasets restrict search dependencies metadata datasets. metadata List IIDDA DataCite metadata collection datasets. digitization_ids Character vector identifiers digitizations. digitization_id Single digitization identifier.

title: Data Provenance — urls
text: url_scans(): Convert scan identifiers URLs link associated scans (typically PDF files). url_digitizations(): Convert digitization identifiers URLs link associated digitizations (typically Excel files). url_affected_scripts(): Returns URLs prep scripts output modified identified digitization modified.
